CONCLUSION: Violation of P1-1;Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . Mr and PERSON were the owners of an apartment in GPE , which they had let to M.C.B.
CARDINAL . In a registered letter of CARDINAL DATE , they informed the tenant that they intended to terminate the lease on expiry of the term on DATE and asked her to vacate the LOC by DATE .
CARDINAL . In a writ served on the tenant on DATE , they reiterated their intention to terminate the lease and summoned the tenant to appear before the Florence Magistrate .
CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE , which was made enforceable on DATE , the Florence Magistrate upheld the validity of the notice to quit and ordered that the LOC be vacated by DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant became the owner of the apartment .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant served notice on the tenant requiring her to vacate the premises .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant made a statutory declaration that she urgently required the premises as accommodation for herself .
CARDINAL . On DATE , she served notice on the tenant informing her that the order for possession would be enforced by a bailiff on DATE .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE , the bailiff made CARDINAL attempts to recover possession . Each attempt proved unsuccessful , as the applicant was never granted the assistance of the police in enforcing the order for possession .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the tenant vacated the LOC and the applicant recovered possession of the flat .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is described in the ORG ’s judgment in the case of ORG GPE [ ORG ] , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , ORG CARDINAL-V.
